resources.string: No need, you are already a developer
Ethernet is already connected.\nPlease disconnect it before connect to Wi-Fi
This clears information used to connect to this network, including a saved password
Enter a network prefix length between 0 and 32
Enter a valid IP address or leave empty.\nExample: 8.8.8.8
Enter a valid IP address or leave empty.\nExample: 8.8.4.4
Enter a valid IP address or leave empty.\nExample: 192.168.1.1
Enter a valid network prefix length.\nExample: 24
This exclusion list isn\â€™t valid. Enter a comma-separated list of excluded domains.
If the host field is empty, leave the port field empty
HTTP proxy is used by the browser but may not be used by other apps
Enter a comma-separated list of excluded domains or leave blank.\nExample: example.com,mycomp.test.com,localhost
Already connected to %1$s. Connect to a different network?
Press the Wi-Fi Protected Setup button on your router.\nIt may be called \"WPS\" or contain the symbol to the left.
Enter PIN %1$s on your Wi-Fi router
After you enter the PIN, setup can take up to 2 minutes to finish
WPS is already in progress and can take up to 2 minutes to finish
Wi-Fi router security setting (WEP) isn\'t supported
Wi-Fi router security setting (TKIP) isn\'t supported
Another WPS session is in progress. Try again in a few minutes.
Let apps that have asked your permission use your location information
Let Google help apps determine location. This means sending anonymous location data to Google, even when no apps are running.
Allow Google\'s location service to collect anonymous location data. Some data may be stored on your device. Collection may occur even when no apps are running.
No apps have requested location recently

Google uses this feature in products like Google Now and Google Maps. Turning on Location Reporting lets any Google product that uses this feature store and use your device\'s most recent location data in connection with your Google Account.

When Location History is turned on for this account, Google can store your device's location data for use by your apps.

For example, Google Maps can give you directions, and Google Now can inform you about commute traffic.

You can turn off Location History at any time, but doing so doesn't delete it. To view and manage your Location History, visit maps.google.com/locationhistory.
This will delete all Location History has stored from this device for this Google Account. You can\'t undo this deletion. Some apps, including Google Now, will stop working.
Settings for closed captioning text overlay on video
%1$s can collect all of the text you type, except passwords. This includes personal data such as credit card numbers.
To update this setting, your device needs to be restarted
Check apps installed via ADB/ADT for harmful behavior
Optimize display for maximum resolution or maximum framerate. This only affects Ultra HD displays. Changing this setting will restart your device.
Debugged application waits for debugger to attach before executing
Flash views inside windows when drawn with the GPU
Flash hardware layers green when they update
From best to worst: blue, green, light red, red
Flash entire window surfaces when they update
Flash screen when apps do long operations on main thread
Screen overlay showing current CPU usage
Measure rendering time in adb shell dumpsys gfxinfo
Allow installation of apps from sources other than the Play Store

Your device and personal data are more vulnerable to attack by apps from unknown sources. You agree that you are solely responsible for any damage to your device or loss of data that may result from using these apps.
Disallow or warn before installation of apps that may cause harm
